conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph and distance to determine if the pedestrian can catch up with the bus.
The pedestrian's velocity is constant at 8 m/s, and the bus starts moving at 0 m/s.
The bus starts moving at 0 m/s, taking 8 seconds to reach this speed.
The bus travels 8 meters in the time it takes to start moving.
The pedestrian takes 4.5 seconds to cover the 36 meters distance.
Since 4.5 seconds is less than 8 seconds, the pedestrian can catch up with the bus.
The pedestrian can catch up with the bus, so the answer is yes.
